content: I spent the last several days reviewing the numerous threads and contributions of posters. I have a question for anyone wishing to opine. Have noticed some people suspended and they seem to be only those who disagree with pro-gay positions. Will I be suspended if I say things others disagree with?
reply: I spent the last several days reviewing the numerous threads and contributions of posters. I have a question for anyone wishing to opine. Have noticed some people suspended and they seem to be only those who disagree with pro-gay positions. Will I be suspended if I say things others disagree with?
title: I'm new here, so cut me some slack

content: I hope not. I've been suspended for things I've posted in this forum in the past, and a quick look at the threads would pretty quickly clue you in to my opinions on the issue. I suspect that suspensions have more to do with the delivery than the message, whether that delivery is in the open forum or through emails.
reply: I hope not. I've been suspended for things I've posted in this forum in the past, and a quick look at the threads would pretty quickly clue you in to my opinions on the issue. I suspect that suspensions have more to do with the delivery than the message, whether that delivery is in the open forum or through emails.

title: I'm new here, so cut me some slack

content: quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I'm still waiting for mainedawg to show me some examples of what TOS violations got posters suspended, but why are you so shy, Vicdude? I was going to send you an E-mail but with your profile status being "private", you can't receive E-mails from other Military.com members. Your privacy is assured by the built-in E-mail program on this site which doesn't give out your E-mail address to other members when you send or receive E-mails via the system used here. To your question, One member was suspended for "Publicly Calling out a Moderator", this means we do not question a Mods decisions in the open Forums. If you have a gripe with a Moderators decision, you E-mail the Moderator and make your case. The member who was suspended for this infraction had been warned not to do this again, but he persisted. Another member was suspended because he/she had a prior suspension and had not requested reinstatement. This individual tried creating a new account in order to get around the prior suspension. I don't know if the prior suspension was temporary or permanent in nature. Other rules; Don't call other members derogatory names, Don't try bypassing the word filter, Don't disrespect the military service of other members, Don't use Hot Links that are not approved by this site, Don't spam - as in soliciting for other web sites, etc. These are just a few that come to mind, perhaps others can lend their expertise and help fill in for any that I have missed. The Moderators are generally lenient and will give you a warning first, especially if your new here and not familiar with the boundaries. Respectfully, Jim
quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I'm still waiting for mainedawg to show me some examples of what TOS violations got posters suspended, but why are you so shy, Vicdude?

Another member was suspended because he/she had a prior suspension and had not requested reinstatement. This individual tried creating a new account in order to get around the prior suspension. I don't know if the prior suspension was temporary or permanent in nature. Other rules; Don't call other members derogatory names, Don't try bypassing the word filter, Don't disrespect the military service of other members, Don't use Hot Links that are not approved by this site, Don't spam - as in soliciting for other web sites, etc. These are just a few that come to mind, perhaps others can lend their expertise and help fill in for any that I have missed. The Moderators are generally lenient and will give you a warning first, especially if your new here and not familiar with the boundaries. Respectfully, Jim

content: quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I saw the term 'chew toy' used. Can someone explain what was meant by that? It gave the appearance that one side of an ongoing debate was being pandered to. Am I wrong about that perception? Yes, you are wrong. If you have a question concerning what a Moderator says or does on these boards, I'd suggest you contact that Moderator by clicking on their name or clicking on the "Triangle" of the Moderators post that you wish to question and consult with him/her privately. You've already been made aware of the rule about "Calling out a Moderator Publicly", it would behoove you to follow that rule unless your itching to get yourself suspended.

content: quote: Originally posted by JimCrackCorn: quote: Originally posted by 21194237: I'm still waiting for mainedawg to show me some examples of what TOS violations got posters suspended, but why are you so shy, Vicdude? I was going to send you an E-mail but with your profile status being "private", you can't receive E-mails from other Military.com members. Your privacy is assured by the built-in E-mail program on this site which doesn't give out your E-mail address to other members when you send or receive E-mails via the system used here. To your question, One member was suspended for "Publicly Calling out a Moderator", this means we do not question a Mods decisions in the open Forums. If you have a gripe with a Moderators decision, you E-mail the Moderator and make your case. The member who was suspended for this infraction had been warned not to do this again, but he persisted. Another member was suspended because he/she had a prior suspension and had not requested reinstatement. This individual tried creating a new account in order to get around the prior suspension. I don't know if the prior suspension was temporary or permanent in nature. Other rules; Don't call other members derogatory names, Don't try bypassing the word filter, Don't disrespect the military service of other members, Don't use Hot Links that are not approved by this site, Don't spam - as in soliciting for other web sites, etc. These are just a few that come to mind, perhaps others can lend their expertise and help fill in for any that I have missed. The Moderators are generally lenient and will give you a warning first, especially if your new here and not familiar with the boundaries. Respectfully, Jim Jim: I'm currently receiving e-mails from other posters here that I've designated as friends. Perhaps that is what I need to do in order to get some from you?
